alert.note: Alert for Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 6:51AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding along Irondequoit Creek and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following county, Monroe. * WHEN...Until 145 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 644 AM EST, due to a combination of heavy rain and snow melt. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rochester, Irondequoit, East Rochester, Fairport, Brighton and Penfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
